title: Area of a Circle
summary: Find the area of a circle using radius or diameter.
whenToUse: Use for round features like posts, columns, or circular cut-outs.
steps: If you have diameter, halve it to get radius.
Multiply by π to get area.
commonMistakes: Mixing units for radius and output.
siteTips: Use a trammel or string line for reliable radius measurements.
Keep more decimal places for small circles.
verification: Area should be a little under 0.3 m² for a 0.6 m diameter.
